title: Authors and Citation
text: package maintainer. Maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Ww (2024). BRREWABC: BRREW-ABC - Batched Resilient Rapid Estimation Workflow Approximate Bayesian Computation. R package version 0.1.0, https://gaelbn.github.io/BRREW-ABC/, https://github.com/GaelBn/BRREW-ABC.
code: @Manual{,   title = {BRREWABC: BRREW-ABC - Batched Resilient and Rapid Estimation Workflow through Approximate Bayesian Computation},   author = {Who wrote it},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.1.0, https://gaelbn.github.io/BRREW-ABC/},   url = {https://github.com/GaelBn/BRREW-ABC}, }

what: BRREW-ABC - Batched Resilient and Rapid Estimation Workflow through Approximate Bayesian Computation
title: BRREW-ABC - Batched Resilient and Rapid Estimation Workflow through Approximate Bayesian Computation
text: BRREW-ABC (Batched Resilient Rapid Estimation Workflow Approximate Bayesian Computation) : R package designed facilitate inference parallelized Approximate Bayesian Computation Sequential Monte Carlo (ABC SMC) algorithm. package streamlines process conducting Bayesian inference complex models implementing efficient parallelization techniques.

title: BRREW-ABC - Batched Resilient and Rapid Estimation Workflow through Approximate Bayesian Computation
text: can install development version BRREWABC GitHub :

title: BRREW-ABC - Batched Resilient and Rapid Estimation Workflow through Approximate Bayesian Computation
text: basic example shows solve common problem: Pairplot iterations Threshold evolution iterations Density estimates alpha Density estimates beta
code: library(BRREWABC)  # model definition compute_dist = function(x, ss_obs){     ss_sim = c( x[["alpha"]] + x[["beta"]] + rnorm(1,0,0.1),            x[["alpha"]] * x[["beta"]] + rnorm(1,0,0.1) ) # a very simple toy model     dist = sum((ss_sim-ss_obs)^2)     return(c(dist)) }  MODEL_LIST <- list("m1" = compute_dist) PRIOR_DIST <- list("m1" = list(c('alpha', 'unif', 0, 4), c('beta', 'unif', 0, 1)))  # create a reference trajectory sum_stat_obs = c(2.0,0.75)  # run abc smc procedure res = abcsmc(model_list = MODEL_LIST, prior_dist = PRIOR_DIST,   ss_obs = sum_stat_obs, max_number_of_gen = 10, nb_acc_prtcl_per_gen = 1000,   new_threshold_quantile = 0.8, experiment_folderpath = "",   max_concurrent_jobs = 2, verbose = TRUE) #> [1] "tmp/currentABCState.RData" #> Check folder_path for : tmp #> Folder created successfully. #> Check folder_path for : res #> Folder created successfully. #> Check folder_path for : res/csv #> Folder created successfully. #> Check folder_path for : res/figs #> Folder created successfully. #> gen 1  #> threshold:  #> prtrbtn_krnl_sd: NA NA  #> - #> gen 2  #> threshold: 3.957004  #> prtrbtn_krnl_sd: 1.15533 0.2888219  #> - #> gen 3  #> threshold: 2.21928  #> prtrbtn_krnl_sd: 0.9438753 0.2654561  #> - #> gen 4  #> threshold: 1.326846  #> prtrbtn_krnl_sd: 0.7723687 0.2661741  #> - #> gen 5  #> threshold: 0.8512537  #> prtrbtn_krnl_sd: 0.6380401 0.2745553  #> - #> gen 6  #> threshold: 0.540139  #> prtrbtn_krnl_sd: 0.542202 0.2599372  #> - #> gen 7  #> threshold: 0.3840295  #> prtrbtn_krnl_sd: 0.474508 0.251434  #> - #> gen 8  #> threshold: 0.2651064  #> prtrbtn_krnl_sd: 0.4081638 0.2415765  #> - #> gen 9  #> threshold: 0.1826087  #> prtrbtn_krnl_sd: 0.3521538 0.227762  #> - #> gen 10  #> threshold: 0.1300748  #> prtrbtn_krnl_sd: 0.3267991 0.2101253  #> - #> Experiment done!  # get results and plots all_accepted_particles = res$particles all_thresholds = res$thresholds plot_abcsmc_res(data = all_accepted_particles, prior = PRIOR_DIST, colorpal = "GnBu") #> [1] "Plot saved as '.png'." #> Registered S3 method overwritten by 'GGally': #>   method from    #>   +.gg   ggplot2 plot_densityridges(data = all_accepted_particles, prior = PRIOR_DIST, colorpal = "GnBu") #> [1] "Plot saved as '.png'." plot_thresholds(data = all_thresholds, nb_threshold = 1, colorpal = "GnBu") #> [1] "Plot saved as 'png'."

what: Run ABC-SMC inference in parallel — abcsmc
title: Run ABC-SMC inference in parallel — abcsmc
text: Run ABC-SMC inference parallel

title: Run ABC-SMC inference in parallel — abcsmc
code:
abcsmc(   model_list = list(),   model_def = NULL,   prior_dist = list(),   ss_obs = NA,   max_number_of_gen = 15,   nb_acc_prtcl_per_gen = 1000,   var_prtrbtn_krnl = NA,   var_prtrbtn_krnl_min = 0.01,   scaling_sd_prtrbtn_krnl = 1,   model_jump_prob = 0.1,   nb_threshold = 1,   new_threshold_quantile = 0.8,   distance_threshold_min = 0.01,   max_attempts = 1e+05,   acceptance_rate_min = 0.01,   use_lhs_for_first_iter = TRUE,   experiment_folderpath = "./",   on_cluster = FALSE,   cluster_type = NULL,   slurm_script_template =     "#!/bin/bash
# THE FOLLOWING SECTION SHOULD NOT BE MODIFIED
#SBATCH --job-name=job-array_%%A_%%a   # nom du job
#SBATCH --ntasks=1
#SBATCH --ntasks-per-node=1
#SBATCH --hint=nomultithread
#SBATCH --time=24:00:00
#SBATCH --array=%s-%s%%%d
output_fpath=$s
error_fpath=$s
#SBATCH --output=$output_fpath/output_%%A_%%a.out
#SBATCH --error=$error_fpath/error_%%A_%%a.out
mkdir -p $output_fpath
mkdir -p $error_fpath
Rscript $s $SLURM_ARRAY_TASK_ID
",   sge_script_template =     "#!/bin/bash
#$ -S /bin/bash
#$ -N subjob_abcsmc_prlll
#$ -q "short.q|long.q"
# THE FOLLOWING SECTION SHOULD NOT BE MODIFIED
#$ -cwd
#$ -V
#$ -t %s-%s
#$ -tc %d
#$ -o /dev/null
#$ -e /dev/null
output_fpath=$s
error_fpath=$s
mkdir -p $output_fpath
mkdir -p $error_fpath
Rscript $s $SGE_TASK_ID >$output_fpath/subjob.${SGE_TASK_ID}.out 2>$error_fpath/subjob.${SGE_TASK_ID}.err
",   max_concurrent_jobs = 1,   abc_user_param_file_path = NULL,   previous_gens = NA,   previous_epsilons = NA,   verbose = FALSE )

title: Run ABC-SMC inference in parallel — abcsmc
text: model_list list linking model name ( character string) associated function model_def R file containing model(s) function(s) prior_dist list linking model name (character string) list describing prior distribution parameter estimated ss_obs observed summary statistics max_number_of_gen maximum number generations performed nb_acc_prtcl_per_gen number particles (per model, total number corresponding number multiplied number models) accepted generation moving next one var_prtrbtn_krnl standard deviation used perturbation kernel, NA empirical standard deviation used instead var_prtrbtn_krnl_min minimum standard deviation used perturbation kernel (must greater zero) scaling_sd_prtrbtn_krnl scaling parameter increasing decreasing value standard deviation used perturbation kernel model_jump_prob probability changing model creating new particle nb_threshold number thresholds used, corresponding number distances returned function(s) stipulated model list (model_list) new_threshold_quantile quantile used decrease threshold(s) iterations distance_threshold_min minimum threshold procedure stops (order prevent excessively long computations) max_attempts maximum number particles tested iteration, beyond procedure stops (order prevent excessively long computations) acceptance_rate_min acceptance rate procedure stops (order prevent excessively long computations) use_lhs_for_first_iter whether use LHS sampling method first iteration experiment_folderpath folder carry estimation procedure save results on_cluster whether procedure run computation cluster cluster_type cluster type used (sge slurm currently supported) slurm_script_template script used launch jobs slurm cluster sge_script_template script used launch jobs sge cluster max_concurrent_jobs maximum number jobs/tasks run parallel abc_user_param_file_path R file containing algorithm's parameters (usage recommended, included version reasons compatibility procedure script form used projects) previous_gens object (dataframe) containing previous results (set iterations), order start last iteration performed previous_epsilons object (dataframe) containing previous results (set thresholds), order start last iteration performed verbose whether display specific information

title: Run ABC-SMC inference in parallel — abcsmc
text: list containing two dataframes corresponding (1) particles accepted (2) thresholds used, successive iterations

title: Run ABC-SMC inference in parallel — abcsmc
code: library(BRREWABC)  # model definition compute_dist = function(x, ss_obs){     ss_sim = c( x[["alpha"]] + x[["beta"]] + rnorm(1,0,0.1),            x[["alpha"]] * x[["beta"]] + rnorm(1,0,0.1) ) # a very simple toy model     dist = sum((ss_sim-ss_obs)^2)     return(c(dist)) }  MODEL_LIST <- list("m1" = compute_dist) PRIOR_DIST <- list("m1" = list(c('alpha', 'unif', 0, 4), c('beta', 'unif', 0, 1)))  # create a reference trajectory sum_stat_obs = c(2.0,0.75)  # run abc smc procedure res = abcsmc(model_list = MODEL_LIST, prior_dist = PRIOR_DIST, ss_obs = sum_stat_obs, max_number_of_gen = 10, nb_acc_prtcl_per_gen = 1000, new_threshold_quantile = 0.8, experiment_folderpath = "", max_concurrent_jobs = 2, verbose = FALSE)  # get results and plots all_accepted_particles = res$particles all_thresholds = res$thresholds plot_abcsmc_res(data = all_accepted_particles, prior = PRIOR_DIST, colorpal = "GnBu") #> [1] "Plot saved as '.png'." #> Registered S3 method overwritten by 'GGally': #>   method from    #>   +.gg   ggplot2 plot_densityridges(data = all_accepted_particles, prior = PRIOR_DIST, colorpal = "GnBu") #> [1] "Plot saved as '.png'." plot_thresholds(data = all_thresholds, nb_threshold = 1, colorpal = "GnBu") #> [1] "Plot saved as 'png'."

what: Plot abcsmc results : pairplot and model selection — plot_abcsmc_res
title: Plot abcsmc results : pairplot and model selection — plot_abcsmc_res
text: Plot abcsmc results : pairplot model selection

title: Plot abcsmc results : pairplot and model selection — plot_abcsmc_res
code: plot_abcsmc_res(   data,   prior,   filename = "pairplot.png",   figtitle = "ABC smc results",   colorpal = "GnBu",   iter = NA )

title: Plot abcsmc results : pairplot and model selection — plot_abcsmc_res
text: data dataframe containing estimation results (set particles accepted iterations) prior list linking model name (character string) list describing prior distribution parameter estimated (used abcsmc function) filename file name used save plots (extension defines format: pdf png) figtitle figure title colorpal palette name used RColorBrewer package iter NA, id (number) iteration plotted

title: Plot abcsmc results : pairplot and model selection — plot_abcsmc_res
